content.description: A can of beans of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to the end of a vertical spring of spring constant <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> that is secured to the ceiling. At time <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math>, the can has moved a downward distance <math alttext="d equals the fraction m g over k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math> from its initial position, and the acceleration of the can is <math alttext="a sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 1 equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>, because the can is at the equilibrium position of the can-spring-Earth system.

<math alttext="a sub 1 equals maximum" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>maximum</mtext></mstyle></math>, because the speed of the can is at its maximum.
